alert.note: Alert for East Turnagain Arm (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 11:26PM AKST until January 29 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulation of 6 to 14 inches for a total snow accumulation of 10 to 24 inches. * WHERE...East Turnagain Arm, Seward Highway. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A low pressure system pushing towards Prince William Sound will bring heavy snow along the Seward Highway from Girdwood to Portage, through Turnagain Pass and south to Seward. While snow is expected to persist through Monday night, the heaviest snow and highest snow accumulation will be during the evening hours this evening into Monday morning with more than a foot possible. Snow rates may exceed 1 inch per hour at times, resulting in periods of poor visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
